result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Allen L Knudson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 10/08/15 at the Justice Center.

miscConds.notes: $1,700 fine plus costs including court appointed attorney fees due Door County. Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
To pay restitution in an amount to be determined, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release and good time granted. To commence forthwith.
7/16/15 - Court removes sentence credit from JOC.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail request for sentence modification - defendant request furlough for funeral of brother-in-law. Court grants furlough from 2/12/16 through 2/14/16. Can make arrangements with jail staff. NO ALCOHOL! DTE

DC Jail request for sentence modification - Defendant would like furlough for brother-in-laws funeral as he's in the hospital and not doing well. Court will deal with it when it unfortunately happens. Court will allow furlough for funeral. DTE
Door County Jail - Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests stay of part of his sentence. Court denies request.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allen L Knudson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Follow up letter from Atty Reetz with return to work certificate from defendants physician.
from Atty Reetz asking to reschedule 6/15/15 plea hearing because of a medical issue with defendant. Court reschedules.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-29-2015 03:00 pm
from Atty Reetz asking court to set plea/sentencing date until after 6/08/15. Court reschedules.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-15-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 05-29-2015 11:45 am
State's Discovery Demand
Defense waives reading of Information, anticipating it mirroring the crimiminal complaint, and enters not guilty plea. Court reminds defendant of monthly attorney fee payments. Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file Information and Discovery Demand later today.

Defendant Allen L Knudson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews amended complaint and max. penalties with defendant. Defense waives reading of the amended complaint, waives time limit for prelim.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court appoints Atty Brett Reetz to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $125 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 2/15/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allen L Knudson in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests time to retain an atty or fill out form for court appointed atty. If defendant wishes to go with court appointed atty, he's to fill form out and file it with the court early in February.  Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
by Jeff Peters

Defendant Allen L Knudson appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
